alert.note: Alert for McDonald (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 4:35AM CDT until March 26 at 7:40AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry, McDonald and Newton. * WHEN...Until 330 PM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 434 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Butler Creek at Kings Highway, Little Sugar Creek at Skaggs Hollow Road, North Indian Creek at Orchid Drive, Hickory Creek at Coler RD, Elkhorn Creek at Highway CC, Buffalo Creek at Klondike Road and Shoal Creek at Farm Road 2110. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Neosho, Monett, Pineville, Anderson, Noel, Goodman, Purdy, South West City, Lanagan, Fairview, and Big Sugar Creek State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
